results.title: Temptress moon = Feng yue
results.creator_credit: Tomson Films, Tong Cunlin, Hsu Feng and Chen Kaige
results.brief_description: Set in 1911 in Shanghai, during a time of political upheaval following the fall of the last emperor and the proclamation of the Republic, ‘Temptress Moon’ follows the slow downfall of the Pang family, a once rich and powerful clan slowly sinking into anarchy and opium addiction. Zhongliang (Leslie Cheung), an orphan boy, is introduced into the Pang family by his sister who is married to the heir of the family. In order to earn his keep, he is employed as a servant, his special duty looking after the opium pipes of his master. Following years of mistreatment, Zhonliang runs away to Beijing where he joins a gang run by Biggie. In Beijing, Zhongliang plies his trade as a gigolo and blackmailer. When news reaches Beijing that the Pang family has passed on the reigns of the estate to a a woman, Ruyi (Gong Li), and a cousin, Duanwu (Kevin Lin), Biggie sends Zhongliang back to Shanghai to seduce Ruyi and take over the estate. As Zhongliang infiltrates his way back into the Pang family, his childhood passion for Ruyi is revived and he finds it near impossible to carry out his mission. According to Chen Kaige, ‘Temptress moon’ can be seen as pure psychological drama, a film on male domination and hierarchy in China at that time, or as the story of a girl becoming a woman. But what mattered to the director was to produce a film on contemporary China, in spite of the historical setting. The film encountered many obstructions from the Chinese authorities due to its matter-of-fact depiction of sex and drug use and its barely masked reference to current political issues. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Tempted
results.creator_credit: Golden Circle Films, TFI International, Bill Bennett, Jennifer Cluff, David Kronemyer and Larry Katz
results.brief_description: Written, produced and directed by Australian filmmaker Bill Bennett (“Kiss or Kill”) this erotic thriller set in Louisiana, New Orleans, explores the boundaries of fidelity and friendship. A wealthy businessman Charlie (Burt Reynolds) pays a young carpenter, Jimmy (Peter Facinelli), who is under his employ to try and seduce his wife, offering to pay him $10,000 for the attempt and a further $40,000 if he can identify a ‘mark’ hidden on her body. Although he swears not to tell anyone about the offer Jimmy confides in his best friend, showing him the photograph of the young and beautiful wife Lilly (Saffron Burrows). Not trusting his wife or Jimmy, Charlie uses the services of a private detective to wire his house and obtain video evidence of any possible sexual encounters. As it is the steamy South, guns, intrigue and murder ensue as Lilly finds out about the deal and goes ahead with the affair. Great original music composed by David Bridie adds to the swampy New Orleans locations.

results.title: Tempo: Australia in the 70's [Italan version]
results.creator_credit: Roland Beckett, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Keith Gow
results.brief_description: Gives impressions of life and industry in Australia at the beginnings of the 1970’s with the emphasis on the potential for growth and development. Peter Weir co-wrote the script with Keith Gow and Martin Von Borneman was the Director of Photography. Animation by Yoram Gross. The original production has been dubbed in Italian.

results.title: Temples of time [Short Version]
results.brief_description: A mountain is a living thing; it has an ecological balance, a process of evolution manifested in slow, subtle ways; but it is also subject to the ravages of man’s technology. Filmed in the Canadian Rockies and in Garibaldi Park, this picture brings to the screen magnificent footage of mountain solitudes and the wildlife found there, of natural splendor in all its changing moods. The film carries the implicit warning that all this may pass away if people do not seek to preserve it. Film without words.

results.title: Temple on the hill
results.creator_credit: George Wallace-Crabbe, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Kay Rasool
results.brief_description: The Sikh community have played a role in the Northern Australian community at Woolgoolga, New South Wales since the turn of last century. Initially coming as labourers the Sikh’s, who now have a stronghold in the community, own and run 90% of the banana plantations in the area. This documentary deals with assimilation and identity and uses the example of both a traditional and progressive Sikh family to discuss the difficulties with language, marriage and family responsibilities in changing times. As the mature generations grow old, maintaining a culture becomes increasingly difficult as the younger generations more easily are attracted to and absorbed into Australia’s western lifestyle.

results.title: Temple of twenty pagodas
results.creator_credit: John Morris, Brian Hannant and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian Neighbours: Thailand”.
In Northern Island is a monastery said to be two thousand years old. It is called “Wa Chedi Sao”, which in Northern Thai means the Temple of Twenty Pagodas. This film is about the daily life of the monastery and the village which it serves.

results.title: Tempest
results.brief_description: Paul Mazurky’s modern day reworking of Shakespeare’s “Tempest” is an extraordinary comedy about a consumate dissatisfied man (John Cassavetes), no longer able to tolerate the compromises he has made in his stormy marriage. Cast includes Susan Sarandon, Gena Rowlands, Molly Ringwald, Raul Julia and the spectacular vistas of the Greek Isles.

results.title: Temperature, pulse and respiration
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”
Demonstrates how to take the pulse, temperature, and respiration explaining how to accomplish these tasks methodically and pointing out the location where the pulse beat may be heard.
